xxl.core.relational.query.operators
Class Randoms

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.query.operators.Randoms

public class Randoms
extends Object

This class provides static methods for creating ready to use instances of a random node in a directed acyclic graph that provides random data. Beside the methods, it contains constants for identifying local metadata fragments inside an operator node's global metadata, methods for accessing them and local metadata factories for updating them.

See Also:
Node

Field Summary
static String DELAY
          This constant is used to identify the delay between two succesive elements in an active random operator's data inside its global metadata.
static int INFINITE
          This constant can be used to denote that the number of elements a random operator is able to produce is infinte.

          This constant is used to identify the number of elements a random operator is able to produce inside its global metadata.

          This constant can be used to denote that a node represents a random operator in the directed acyclic graph.

          A factory method that can be used to translate a logical random operator into an appropriate implementation.

          This constant is used to identify a random operator's type inside its global metadata.

          A factory method that can be used to transform the XML representation of a random operator into the node itself.
static Function<Object,Node> XML_WRITER
          A factory method that can be used to transform a random operator into its XML representation.

Constant Field Values

RESULTSET_METADATA_FACTORY

public static final Function<Object,ResultSetMetaData> RESULTSET_METADATA_FACTORY
A local metadata factory that can be used to create/update the metadata fragment describing the relational data of a random operator. The returned metadata describes a relation having exactly one column providing the random data.

XML_READER

public static final Function<Object,Node> XML_READER
A factory method that can be used to transform the XML representation of a random operator into the node itself.

XML_WRITER

public static final Function<Object,Node> XML_WRITER
A factory method that can be used to transform a random operator into its XML representation.

TRANSLATION_FUNCTION

public static final Function<Object,MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> TRANSLATION_FUNCTION
A factory method that can be used to translate a logical random operator into an appropriate implementation.

Method Detail

newRandom

public static final Node newRandom(int type,
                                   int numberOfElements,
                                   Operators.Mode mode,
                                   int delay)
Creates a new random operator that provides numberOfElements elements of the given type type.

Parameters:
type - the random operator's type, i.e., the type of the elements produced by the random operator.
numberOfElements - the number of elements produced by the random operator.
mode - determines whether this random operator is an active or a passive operator, i.e., whether this random operator transfers its data to its parent operators or the parent operators must request the data from the random operator.
delay - the delay between two succesive elements in the random operator's data. If the given mode equals Operators.Mode.PASSIVE this parameter is totally ignored.
Returns:
a new random operator that provides numberOfElements elements of the given type type.
See Also:
Types

newActiveRandom

public static final Node newActiveRandom(int type,
                                         int numberOfElements,
                                         int delay)
Creates a new active random operator that transfers numberOfElements elements of the given type type to its parent operators.

Parameters:
type - the random operator's type, i.e., the type of the elements produced by the random operator.
numberOfElements - the number of elements produced by the random operator.
delay - the delay between two succesive elements in the random operator's data.
Returns:
a new active random operator that transfers numberOfElements elements of the given type type to its parent operators.
See Also:
